revised_title: On the Refraction of Sound and Atmospheric Conditions
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the refraction of sound by the atmosphere and its relation to temperature gradients. They discovered that sound can be intensified at the surface of water under specific atmospheric conditions, such as a temperature gradient with colder air near the surface. This phenomenon can explain the increased audibility of sounds over long distances in certain situations.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
